title: Is it still possible to use grayscale on android without enabling bedtime mode?
content: Hi all, I have a pixel 2 and I'm wondering what happened to the grayscale button that was on Android when I was using the pixel 1. I had the pixel 1 (don't remember which android version, but it was right when "digital well-being" was introduced), and I loved keeping my phone in grayscale mode 24/7. Now with the pixel 2 (android 10) the only way I can enable grayscale is to use the bedtime mode function, but I don't want my display to be on a schedule, nor do I want "do not disturb" to turn on whenever I enable grayscale mode. Is there a way to do this, or has google unfortunately decided that this feature belongs in the bedtime mode function?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2
